general.label: General Settings

enabled.label: Module Enabled
enabled.comment: A valid license key is required in order to enable the module.

debug.label: Debug Mode Enabled
debug.comment: Enable if you want to see debug information when running the import.

debug_email.label: Error/Debug E-Mail
debug_email.comment: Errors logged during the import will be sent to this email address.

last_exception.label: Last error message
last_exception.comment: Further log files can be found in the /var/log/ directory.

test_mode.label: Test Mode Enabled
test_mode.comment: By enabling this the imported files will NOT get processed nor moved to the archive directory. A test import will be ran and the import results will be shown (a preview) so you can test if the import is configured correctly. DISABLE IN PRODUCTION ENVIRONMENTS. After enabling/disabling test mode, click 'Save Config' before running an import.

import_file.label: Upload file manually
import_file.comment: Select file and click 'Upload file and run import now' below. The 'Local Directory Import' must be enabled and needs an existing import directory.

manual_cron_run.label: OR: Start import job manually
manual_cron_run.comment: Use this button to run the import job like the cronjob would run it.

import.label: Import Settings
import.comment: Notice: Please make sure that the Magento cronjob is set up to run every five minutes: Check out our support wiki for instructions.

mode.label: Import Processor
mode.comment: Set the file type you want to import into Magento. Please also configure the processor you want to use below - either the "CSV Processor" or "XML Processor" section at the bottom of this page.

cron_enabled.label: Enable Cronjob
cron_enabled.comment: If disabled, it is still possible to initiate the import manually using the 'Run Import manually' function.

frequency.label: Import frequency
frequency.comment: Make sure the custom cron expression field below is empty before trying to change this field.

custom_cron.label: Custom cron expression
custom_cron.comment: Set a custom cron expression for the import frequency. Only change this if you know what you're doing. Example: * * * * *

do_capture.label: Capture payment for invoice
do_capture.comment: This will try to capture the payment at the payment gateway, i.e. charge the credit card if you authorized the payment.

do_partial_invoices.label: Import partial invoices
do_partial_invoices.comment: This requires the SKU and quantity fields in the import file to be filled with data. The order will then only get invoiced for the imported SKU and quantity. Otherwise the order will simply be invoiced completely.

add_shipments_without_trackingnumbers.label: Import shipments without tracking numbers
add_shipments_without_trackingnumbers.comment: If set to 'Yes' shipments will ALWAYS be created, even if there are no tracking numbers in the import file.

add_multiple_trackingnumbers.label: Add tracking numbers to existing shipments & import multiple tracking numbers
add_multiple_trackingnumbers.comment: If the import file contains more than one tracking number for one order or if the order has been already shipped, these tracking numbers will get added to the most recent shipment of the order.

do_partial_shipments.label: Import partial shipments
do_partial_shipments.comment: This requires the SKU and quantity fields in the import file to be filled with data. The order will then only get shipped for the imported SKU and quantity. Otherwise the order will simply be shipped completely.

do_change_status_partial_order.label: Change order status after importing partial order
do_change_status_partial_order.comment:
If a partial shipped/invoiced order gets imported, change the order status to a specific status.
Attention: Do not use the "On Hold" status for partial shipments, as otherwise no further shipments can be created.

do_change_status.label: Change order status after import (or when order has been completely invoiced/shipped)
do_change_status.comment: You can either import the status from the file you're importing (see processor options), or statically change the order status to the status set here after the order has been completely shipped.

timeout.label: Timeout
timeout.comment: Timeout in seconds after which the connection to the server fails

ssl.label: Use FTP SSL connection (FTPS)
ssl.comment: Only available if PHP has been compiled with OpenSSL support. You cannot enable this option and the SFTP option one field below at the same time.

use_sftp.label: OR: Use SFTP connection (Secure File Transfer Protocol)
use_sftp.comment: Supports SFTPv3 only, used by OpenSSH for example. Make sure to enter the correct port - SFTP uses port 22 usually. You cannot enable this option and the FTPS option one field above at the same time.

pasv_mode.label: Enable Passive mode
pasv_mode.comment: If your server is behind a firewall, or if the extension has problems downloading the import files, please set this to "Yes".

path.label: Base Path
path.comment: This is the absolute path to the directory on the FTP server containing the import files. This directory has to exist on the FTP server.

filename_pattern.label: Filename Pattern
filename_pattern.comment: This needs to be a valid regular expression. The regular expression will be used to detect the import files. The import will fail if the pattern is invalid. Example: /csv/i for all files with the csv file extension or for all files in the import directory: //

archive_folder.label: Archive Folder
archive_folder.comment: If you want to move the imported file(s) to another directory after they have been processed, please enter the path here. This is the absolute path to the archive directory on the FTP server. This directory has to exist on the FTP server. Leave empty if you don't want to archive the import files.

delete_files.label: Delete imported files
delete_files.comment: Set this to "Yes" if you want to delete the imported file from the FTP server after it has been processed. You can't delete and archive at the same time, so choose either this option or the archive option above.

path.label: Local Directory
path.comment: This is the path to the local directory containing the import files. This path needs to be absolute.

filename_pattern.label: Filename Pattern
filename_pattern.comment: This needs to be a valid regular expression. The regular expression will be used to detect the import files. The import will fail if the pattern is invalid. Example: /csv/i for all files with the csv file extension or for all files in the import directory: //

archive_folder.label: Archive Folder
archive_folder.comment: If you want to move the imported file(s) to another directory after they have been processed, please enter the path here. This is the absolute path to the archive directory. This directory has to exist. Leave empty if you don't want to archive the import files.

delete_files.label: Delete imported file
delete_files.comment: Set this to "Yes" if you want to delete the imported file(s) from the local directory after they have been processed.

processor_csv.label: CSV Import Processor Settings
processor_csv.comment: Notice: This is the processor for imported CSV files. Please make sure to visit our support wiki for an explanation on how to set up this processor.

skip_header.label: Skip header line
skip_header.comment: IMPORTANT: Set this to "Yes" if you want to skip the first line of each imported CSV file as it's the header line containing the column names.

delimiter.label: Field Delimiter
delimiter.comment:
REQUIRED: Set the field delimiter (one character only). Example field delimiter: ;
Hint: If you want to use a tab delimited file enter: \t

enclosure.label: Field Enclosure Character
enclosure.comment: Set the field enclosure character (one character only). Example: "

chunk_files.label: Create chunk files
chunk_files.comment: By enabling this, imported CSV files will be broken into smaller files (chunks). ONLY enable this if the max_execution_time is set to a too low value on your server. This avoids problems if the import times out because of a too low max_execution_time value. Important: Only works for local directory imports.

import_mapping.label: Field Mapping
import_mapping.comment:
Please set up your field mapping here. You can select the fields available to map from the drop down. Fields marked with an asterisk (*) must be mapped.

Looking for a way to add custom tracking URLs/tracking methods? Check out the Custom Carrier Trackers extension.

shipped_one_field.label: SKU and Quantity in ONE field
shipped_one_field.comment:
If all SKUs and QTYs to process are saved in ONE field, select 'Yes' and use just the "SKU" field in the mapping above. Please make sure the SKU and QTY combinations are saved in the following format:

SKU1:QTY1;SKU2:QTY2;SKU3:QTY3 and so on.

To sum it up: The SKU and QTY are separated by colon and each SKU/QTY combination is separated by a semi-colon.

processor_xml.label: XML Import Processor Settings
processor_xml.comment: Notice: This is the processor for imported XML files. Please make sure to visit our support wiki for an explanation on how to set up this processor.

xpath_data.label: Data XPath
xpath_data.comment:
Set the XPath for the node containing the order status updates.

Example XML file:
<orders>
<order>
...
</order>
<order>
...
</order>

</orders>
The order status updates would be located in each "order" node, which are located in the "orders" node, so the XPath would be: //orders/order

Every "order" node located under the "orders" node would be processed then.

import_mapping.label: Field Mapping
import_mapping.comment:
Please set up your field mapping here. You can select the fields available to map from the drop down. Fields marked with an asterisk (*) must be mapped.

Looking for a way to add custom tracking URLs/tracking methods? Check out the Custom Carrier Trackers extension.

node_nested_items.label: Item data nested in nodes
node_nested_items.comment:
If your item data is nested under the current Data XPath, turn this on. Use this if you want to import this format (item information NESTED under the order information) for example:
<orders><order><id>X</id><tracking>Y</tracking><items><item><sku></sku><qty></qty></item></items></order></orders>
The nested item data node would be items/item then as the items are child nodes of the data node.

Do not use this if you want to import this format for example (item information WITH the order information):
<orders><order><id>X</id><tracking>Y</tracking><sku></sku><qty></qty></order></orders>

shipped_one_field.label: SKU and Quantity in ONE field
shipped_one_field.comment:
If all SKUs and QTYs to process are saved in ONE node, select 'Yes' and enter the node into the "SKU Node" field. Please make sure the SKU and QTY combinations are saved in the following format:

SKU1:QTY1;SKU2:QTY2;SKU3:QTY3 and so on.

To sum it up: The SKU and QTY are separated by colon and each SKU/QTY combination is separated by a semi-colon.
